author: Special Correspondent
text:
With Voter Verifiable Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) units — which will be used in the Anna Nagar Assembly constituency this elections — arriving in the city, the Chennai District Election Office will shortly begin to create awareness of the system.

The VVPAT system gives the voter the option of verifying if he/she has voted for the intended candidate.

Each of the voters in Anna Nagar will be able to see a printout of the symbol of the candidate to whom she/he has voted.

The system was introduced in the Central Chennai parliamentary constituency in the State during the previous Lok Sabha elections.

“Such initiatives are expected to attract more voters to the constituency. We will be trying out various measures to improve turnout during elections,” said an official.

The system was offered in 2014 to 12.8 lakh electors of Central Chennai, which comprises the Assembly segments of Villivakkam, Egmore, Harbour, Chepauk-Triplicane, Thousand Lights and Anna Nagar.

The Election Commission will train master-trainers on how to handle the VVPAT system.

These trainers will train the polling staff to be posted at the Anna Nagar constituency.

title: Officials to spread awareness about paper trail system
